com.dabaeen.XbeeIOIO

Class Xbee

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.dabaeen.XbeeIOIO.Xbee

  • public class Xbee
extends java.lang.Object
    Xbee class represents an Xbee module. It provides the ability to interact with the UART data streams, and to configure the Xbee module using the method configure(XbeeConfiguration, OnDataReceivedListener). Xbee object should be defined in an IOIOLooper, probably in BaseIOIOLooper.setup(IOIO) to be able to assign it to an IOIO. Note that the Xbee methods block the thread they are running on, so either the methods should be called in the BaseIOIOLooper's methods or in a separate thread. Calling its methods on the UI thread will cause interrupted user experience and will cause the application to be unresponsive.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Xbee

        public Xbee(ioio.lib.api.IOIO ioio,
    int rX_pin,
    int tX_pin,
    int baud_rate)
     throws ioio.lib.api.exception.ConnectionLostException
        Creates a new connection to an Xbee device. This must be constructed inside a BaseIOIOLooper constructor. Example: 
        {@literal @}Override
    protected IOIOLooper createIOIOLooper() {
    return new BaseIOIOLooper() {
    {@literal @}Override
    protected void setup() throws ConnectionLostException {
    Xbee xbee = new Xbee(ioio_, 45, 46, 9600);
    }
    }
}
        Parameters:
        ioio - The IOIO device to connect through.
        rX_pin - The receiver pin. Must be 3.3V tolerant and must support UART/USART connection.
        tX_pin - The transmitter pin. Must be 3.3V tolerant and must support UART/USART connection.
        baud_rate - The baud rate of the connection. Must match the baud rate of the Xbee device. The supported standard baud rates are 1200, 2400, 4800, 9600, 19200, 38400, 57600, 115200 bps, and any non-standard baud rates in the range 0x80 - 0x3D090 bps.
        Throws:
        ioio.lib.api.exception.ConnectionLostException - Thrown when the connection to the IOIO has been lost or disconnected.

        Returns:
        The UART InputStream of the Xbee device.

        The UART OutputStream of the Xbee device.

      • closeConnection

        public void closeConnection()
        Closes the UART connection if exists. Does not disconnect the IOIO.

      • configure

        public java.lang.String configure(XbeeConfiguration xbeeConfig,
                         Xbee.OnDataReceivedListener onDataReceivedListener)
                           throws java.io.IOException
        Configures the Xbee device with the XbeeConfiguration xbeeConfig. This method clears the buffer. Example: 
        XbeeConfiguration xbeeConfig = new XbeeConfiguration();
    xbeeConfig.setPanID(0xFF)
    .setSourceAddress(0x12) // Using hex form
    .setDestinationAddress(50); // Using dec form
    xbee.configure(xbeeConfig);
        Parameters:
        xbeeConfig - The configuration parameters.
        onDataReceivedListener - The Xbee.OnDataReceivedListener of which Xbee.OnDataReceivedListener.onDataReceived(String) will be triggered. Could be null.
        Returns:
        The reply from the Xbee.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

                       throws java.io.IOException
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • write

        public void write(java.lang.String data)
           throws java.io.IOException
        Sends data to the Xbee device. End with \n, \r, or a combination to send directly. Otherwise you need to flush.
        Parameters:
        data - The data to be sent. Discards if data is null.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

               throws java.io.IOException

      • read

        public java.lang.String read()
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Reads the data. Waits a maximum of 250 milliseconds for the data to start being received.
        Returns:
        The data read. Null if no data was read.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • readLine

        public java.lang.String readLine()
                          throws java.io.IOException
        Reads a line of data. Blocks the thread until data is received. A line is ended by \r, \n or \r\n.
        Returns:
        The data read. Null if no data was read.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • flush

        public void flush()
           throws java.io.IOException
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • read

        public java.lang.String read(int interval)
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Reads the data that is expected in a defined maximum interval.
        Parameters:
        interval - Approximate maximum interval to wait for the data to start being received in milliseconds. Default is 250msec.
        Returns:
        The data read. Null if no data was read.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • setlogStreamsEnabled

        public void setlogStreamsEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Enables logging of the input and output streams to LogCat. Logs displayed do not ensure successful transmission.

        Set True by default.
        Parameters:
        enabled - True if the streams are to be logged.

      • setOnDataReceivedListener

        public void setOnDataReceivedListener(Xbee.OnDataReceivedListener onDataReceivedListener)
        Sets an Xbee.OnDataReceivedListener for the Xbee device. Triggers onDataReceived when data is received. Do not use read() when a listener is set. Could cause loss of data. The listener will be disabled while #configure(XbeeConfiguration) is running.
        Parameters:
        onDataReceivedListener - The listener in which OnDataReceived will be triggered.

      • enableOnDataReceiverListener

        public void enableOnDataReceiverListener(boolean enable)
        Allows the listener to be disabled then enabled temporarily without the need to remove it.
        Parameters:
        enable - Enables or disables the Xbee.OnDataReceivedListener

      • removeOnDataReceiverListener

        public void removeOnDataReceiverListener()
        Removes the Xbee.OnDataReceivedListener assigned.

      • setOnDataSentListener

        public void setOnDataSentListener(Xbee.OnDataSentListener onDataSentListener)
        Sets an OnDataSentListener for the Xbee device. Triggers onDataSent when data is sent.
        Parameters:
        onDataSentListener - The listener in which OnDataSent will be triggered.

      • removeOnDataSentListener

        public void removeOnDataSentListener()
        Removes the Xbee.OnDataSentListener assigned.
